flagship.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the most important ship in a group of ships belonging to the navy
flagship.translation[0].definitions[1].d: the best and most important product, building etc that a company owns or produces
flagship.translation[0].definitions[1].e: the flagship of the new Ford range
The firm has just opened a flagship store in Las Vegas.
flagship.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a flagship product is the best and most important one that a company produces
flagship.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The St. Louis based brewer, Anheuser-Busch, has just launched a new advertising campaign for its flagship brand, Budweiser.
flagship.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a flagship company is one of the best in its industry or country
flagship.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The UK’s flagship airline BA is facing increased competition from smaller carriers.
flagship.translation[1].definitions[2].d: a flagship building is the best and most important one that a company owns
flagship.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Over a quarter of annual sales still come from the company’s flagship store on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan.
